    Helper function to add a contrast layer to the plot. This is a thin wrapper around ggbrain_layer

    geom_brain.Rd

    Helper function to add a contrast layer to the plot. This is a thin wrapper around ggbrain_layer

    Usage

    geom_brain(...)

    Arguments

    name

    the name of this brain layer

    definition

    a character string of the contrast or image definition used to define this layer. Can be a simple image name (e.g., 'underlay') or a contrast string (e.g., 'overlay[overlay > 5]')

    fill_scale

    the color scale to be used for this layer (a scale_fill* object)

    show_legend

    whether to show the color scale for this layer in the legend

    Value

    a ggb object populated with the ggb_layer and the action of 'add_layers'

    Details

    Note that the fill_scale and limits must be specified at the time of the geom_contrast creation in order for them to be mapped properly within ggplot. Because we overlay many raster layers in a ggplot object that all use the fill aesthetic mapping, it becomes hard to map the color scales after the layer is created using the typical + scale_fill_X syntax, and similarly for scale limits.

    On this page

    Developed by Michael Hallquist.
